newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - Cocoa seen in range, lower bias near-term.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - Cocoa seen in range, lower bias near-term.

text.p: JULY Close * Support * Resist * RSI14 * MA10 * MA30
LIFFE cocoa futures should continue trading in a range with only a small leaning to the downside in the near term, analysts said on Tuesday.
July cocoa was called to open unchanged after closing on Monday down 13 stg at 1,021 stg per tonne.
New York July cocoa gapped lower on Monday and closed down $23 at $1,440, off its session low of $1,427, but volume was light at an estimated 4,610 lots.
Despite Monday's losses, Sucden analyst Adrian Haylor said cocoa did not yet look in danger of a freefall.
He said July might fall to test support at 1,000, but expected either that level or levels just below it to hold.

Strong support was seen near 1,000 because a couple of support levels were clustered around there, Haylor said. A trendline from the February lows was coming in near 1,005, the 40-day moving average was perched on 996 and 980 was the recent low from April 9.
Haylor said only if those levels failed to hold would he consider cocoa to be in a definitive downtrend.
Some traders said a break of 987 would probably start attracting fund sales that could bring the market sharply lower.
Overall, Haylor still considered the earlier slide to 980 as a corrective drop and the subsequent climb back as the "more bullish, impulsive move."
But he did not expect a steep climb until resistance at 1,065, the April 2 high, was broken.
A move toward 1,065 was expected to draw in fund buying, traders said.
